doc.after: After liberation, parts of Auschwitz I served first as a hospital for liberated prisoners.[68] Soviet and Polish investigators worked in the initial months to document the war crimes of the SS.[69] In the two years that followed, the Soviets dismantled and exported the IG Farben factories, and the Birkenau barracks were looted by Polish civilians.[68][70] Area residents sifted the mass graves and ashes for gold.[71] Until 1947, some of the facilities were used as a prison camp of the Soviet NKVD.[72]
